column1: awè l' gozî come ene tchåsse
column2:
verb
  1. (simile) to have a permanent thirst, to like one's drink .

noun
  1. (of hair) curl
  2. loop
  3. (in card games) in "couyon", penalty for a (team of) player(s) losing a play they had declared to win, marked as a curled slash on the result sheet

adj
  1. (of hair) curly.
  2. (of a person) curly-haired.

noun
  1. curly-haired boy, man.
  2. (pleasantly) darling.
  3. (vocative use, informal) man, boy.

verb
  1. to date, to add a date to something

verb
  1. to awake (to gain consciousness)
  2. to awaken someone else

noun
  1. (anatomy, of an animal) snout, face; mouth

pron
  1. who (interrogative pronoun, subject, possibly being followed by "çki" or "k'")
  2. whom (interrogative pronoun, object, possibly being followed by "çki" or "k'")
  3. who (relative pronoun in a general statement)
  4. one (in a choose)

column1: li|les|after an open syllable and before a vowel: ls

pron

column1: riletchî come on vea k' a deus meres
column2:
adj
  1. (simile) very well-dressed; dressed to the nines

verb
  1. (transitive) to return (to give back).
  2. (transitive) to make (+ adjective).
  3. (transitive) (agriculture) to yield, to produce.
  4. (transitive) to vomit.
  5. (transitive)' to render (to interpret).
  6. (takes a reflexive pronoun, si rinde) to surrender.
  7. (takes a reflexive pronoun) to go (to)

noun
  1. to uproot, to root up, to pull up, to tear out, to draw out (a grass, a bush)
  2. to extract, to take out, to pull off (a tooth)
  3. to rip off, to pull out (hair)
  4. to lift (potatoes, beets)
  5. to open widely (one's mouth) to recriminate

verb
  1. to pull
  2. (saetchî on côp d' fizik) : to fire, to shoot
  3. (saetchî al bouxhete, saetchî on limero) : to draw (to determine the result of a lottery)

verb
  1. (transitive, intransitive, the itching person being the direct complement) to itch
  2. (takes a reflexive pronoun) to scratch (an itching place)
  3. (figuratively, familiar, transitive, the desiring person being the direct complement) to itch, to desire
  4. (figuratively, familiar, transitive) to pinch, to swipe, to nick

verb
  1. to remove the branches from a tree
  2. to trim or prune a bush

noun
  1. castle (fortified building or similar structure).
  2. (old) sort of kite.

verb
  1. to think, to ponder, to reflect on

noun
  1. warble (larva of Hypoderma spp. and the skin lesions caused by it).

noun
  1. blinker (eye shield of a horse)
  2. screen (of a TV or computer)
